CatDescriptText: Alberta Walden, social worker, 7121 Monticello Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 4, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that theatrical productions like 'The Green Pastures,' which 'take-off' on religions, should be presented as entertainment?" answer reads: "No. I do not think that anything pertaining to religion should be taken so lightly.  I'm against productions of religious take-offs, regardless of whether they are for television, movies, or other mediums of entertainment.  Also, I dislike the jazzing-up of spirituals.  Anything pertaining to religion or the Bible should not be taken so lightly."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Alberta Walden wearing flecked coat with dark trim and buttons, earrings, and dark hat, posed in front of brick wall with graffiti reading "The...that, that, that..."
